purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of

inscope.li: products of automotive, aerospace and other mechanical manufacturers and of their suppliers, including parts, assemblies of parts, tools, assemblies of tools, and raw materials;
process plan information describing the relationships between parts and the tools used to manufacture them and to manage the relationships between intermediate stages of part or tool development;
product definition data and configuration control data for managing large numbers of variants of automotive products during the design phase;
data describing the changes that have occurred during the design phase, including tracking of the versions of a product and of the data related to the documentation of the change process;
identification of physically realized parts or of tools, e.g., for prototype building;
identification of standard parts, based on international, national, or industrial standards;
release and approval data for product data;
data that identify the supplier of a product and related contract information;
representation of the shape of parts or tools that is a combination of two or more of these nine types of shape representation;
data that pertains to the presentation of the shape of the product;
representation of portions of the shape of a part or a tool by form features;
product documentation represented on drawings;
references to product documentation represented in a format other than those specified by ISO 10303;
simulation data for the description of kinematic structures;
properties of parts or of tools;
data defining surface conditions;
dimensional data and geometrical tolerance data;
items within the scope of application module Assembly constraints, ISO/TS 10303-1794;
items within the scope of application module Change management, ISO/TS 10303-1661;
items within the scope of application module Characterized representation, ISO/TS 10303-1805;
items within the scope of application module Chemical substance, ISO/TS 10303-1655;
items within the scope of application module Composite material aspects, ISO/TS 10303-1768;
items within the scope of application module Compound shape representation, ISO/TS 10303-1327;
items within the scope of application module Constructive solid geometry 2d, ISO/TS 10303-1731;
items within the scope of application module Constructive solid geometry 3d, ISO/TS 10303-1068;
items within the scope of application module Curve swept solid, ISO/TS 10303-1659;
items within the scope of application module Default tolerance, ISO/TS 10303-1052;
items within the scope of application module Design product data management, ISO/TS 10303-1628;
items within the scope of application module Dimension and tolerance callouts, ISO/TS 10303-1362;
items within the scope of application module Dimension tolerance, ISO/TS 10303-1050;
items within the scope of application module Drawing definition, ISO/TS 10303-1309;
items within the scope of application module Elementary boundary representation, ISO/TS 10303-1329;
items within the scope of application module External currency, ISO/TS 10303-1777;
items within the scope of application module External representation item, ISO/TS 10303-1779;
items within the scope of application module Form feature in panel, ISO/TS 10303-1806;
items within the scope of application module Geometric constraints, ISO/TS 10303-1789;
items within the scope of application module Geometric tolerance, ISO/TS 10303-1051;
items within the scope of application module Geometric validation property representation, ISO/TS 10303-1039;
items within the scope of application module Inertia characteristics, ISO/TS 10303-1350;
items within the scope of application module Kinematic analysis control and result, ISO/TS 10303-1817;
items within the scope of application module Machining features, ISO/TS 10303-1814;
items within the scope of application module Manifold subsurface, ISO/TS 10303-1702;
items within the scope of application module Mating structure, ISO/TS 10303-1815;
items within the scope of application module Mechanical design presentation representation with draughting, ISO/TS 10303-1315;
items within the scope of application module Model based 3d geometrical dimensioning and tolerancing representation, ISO/TS 10303-1816;
items within the scope of application module Modified swept solid, ISO/TS 10303-1322;
items within the scope of application module Numerical interface, ISO/TS 10303-1344;
items within the scope of application module Part and zone laminate tables, ISO/TS 10303-1770;
items within the scope of application module Picture representation, ISO/TS 10303-1308;
items within the scope of application module Planned characteristic, ISO/TS 10303-1733;
items within the scope of application module Ply orientation specification, ISO/TS 10303-1772;
items within the scope of application module Process plan, ISO/TS 10303-1803;
items within the scope of application module Product and manufacturing annotation presentation, ISO/TS 10303-1812;
items within the scope of application module Product as individual assembly and test, ISO/TS 10303-1804;
items within the scope of application module Representation with uncertainty, ISO/TS 10303-1228;
items within the scope of application module Shape data quality inspection result, ISO/TS 10303-1524;
items within the scope of application module Shape feature, ISO/TS 10303-1764;
items within the scope of application module Sketch, ISO/TS 10303-1792;
items within the scope of application module Solid with local modification, ISO/TS 10303-1319;
items within the scope of application module Surface conditions, ISO/TS 10303-1110;
items within the scope of application module Text representation, ISO/TS 10303-1750;
items within the scope of application module Thickened face solid, ISO/TS 10303-1320;
items within the scope of application module Wireframe 2d, ISO/TS 10303-1347;
items related to the long-term archiving and retrieval of product data;
items related to motion as it relates to products.

outscope.li: product definition data pertaining to any life cycle phase of a product not related to the design (?or manufacturing?) phase;
?business or financial data for the management of a design project;
?a general parametric representation of the shape of a part or of a tool;
?data describing the pneumatic, hydraulic, electric, or electronic functions of a product;
?data describing the input or the results of finite element analysis.

definition.def: period during which the engineering representation of a product is dynamic
physical object which can be formed from material into a static shape
stored and retrievable specific orientation and magnification factor of a model
complete 3D representation of the nominal shape of a product so that any point in space can be determined to be inside, on the boundary, or outside the solid model
geometric elements included in product definition data to communicate design requirements but not intended to represent a portion of the manufactured product
